Class Order

  • java.lang.Object
    • Order

  • public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this class represents an order made by a buyer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Order()
      Constructs a new Order that has an order id of -1; a Buyer, Seller, and Item of null; a shipped status of false, and an order date-time of null.
      Order(int itemID, int buyerID, int sellerID, boolean shipped)
      Constructs a new Order that will have the given order id number, item, buyer, seller, and shipping status.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBuyerID()
      Returns this order's buyer ID.
      java.time.LocalDateTime getDateAndTime()
      Returns the date and time that this order was made.
      int getID()
      Returns this order's unique identification number.
      int getItemID()
      Returns this order's item ID.
      int getSellerID()
      Returns this order's sellerID.
      boolean getShipped()
      Returns true if the item has been shipped.
      void setBuyerID(int buyerID)
      Sets this order's buyer ID.
      void setDateAndTime(java.time.LocalDateTime dateAndTime)
      Sets this order's date and time.
      void setID(int id)
      Sets this order's unique identification number to the given id number.
      void setItem(int itemID)
      Sets this order's item ID.
      void setSellerID(int sellerID)
      Sets this order's seller.
      void setShipped(boolean status)
      Sets the shipping status of the item.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Order

        public Order(int itemID,
             int buyerID,
             int sellerID,
             boolean shipped)
        Constructs a new Order that will have the given order id number, item, buyer, seller, and shipping status.
        Parameters:
        itemID - the ID of the item that was bought
        buyerID - the ID of the person who made the order
        sellerID - the ID of the person who is selling the item
        shipped - whether the item has been shipped or not

      • Order

        public Order()
        Constructs a new Order that has an order id of -1; a Buyer, Seller, and Item of null; a shipped status of false, and an order date-time of null.

        public boolean getShipped()
        Returns true if the item has been shipped.
        Returns:
        true if item was shipped, or false if the item has not been shipped.

      • setShipped

        public void setShipped(boolean status)
        Sets the shipping status of the item.
        Parameters:
        status - true to set the item's status as shipped, false to set the item's status as not shipped.
